page.title: 16The Game 'Elastics'
page.content: Elastics is a game played by three girls or boys, where you take a piece of strong elastic, about one and a half metres long, tie the ends together and then stretch the elastic above the ankles but below the shins of two people standing about a metre apart. The elastic should then make a narrow rectangular shape around the two people's legs. The idea of the game is to jump in and out of the elastic shape without touching it with your feet. The movement is done to a spoken rhyme. If you complete the saying of the rhyme without letting your feet touch the elastic, you are allowed to go on to a higher level, with the elastic at knee height. The increase in height continues until the person jumping gets caught out.
